result.execSummary:
The defendant John W. Samples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle T&R in defts name as is deft himself.  Device to be installed immediately.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.  No objection to EMP.  DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination

Case Called: 2:16 pm
INCLUDES 14CM552, 15CF482, 14CM1063, 15CF152, 14CM1370, 15CM271, 14TR3420, 14TR1181.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Julie Sawyer.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
14TR3420:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Suspended (2nd))>> DISMISS OUTRIGHT.

14TR1181:
Ct. 1 (Refuse to Take Test for Intoxication After Arrest)>> DEEMED UNLAWFUL.

15CF482:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

14CM1063:
Ct. 1 (BJ)>>DRI.

15CF152:
Information Filed.
Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (BJ)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Operating While Suspended (2nd))>>DRI.

14CM1370:
Ct. 1 (Battery)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ)>>DRI.

15CM271:
Ct. 1 (BJ)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
14CM552:
Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>> NO CONTEST.

15CF152:
Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>> GUILTY.

14CM1370:
Ct. 2 (DC)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
14CM552:
Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: $1,959 fine inclusive of Court Costs, NO DNA Sample or Surcharge. 60 Days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 26 months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 priced IID installation fee to be paid; 26 Month dl revocation; AODA, Absolute Sobriety from Drugs Alcohol. Defendant has 45 days to report to MCJ. No objection to EMP. 

15CF152:
Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: $2,452 fine inclusive of Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. 8 Months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 Years, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 priced IID installation fee to be paid; 3 Years dl revocation; AODA, Absolute sobriety from Drugs and Alcohol. Defendant has 45 days to report to MCJ. No objection to EMP. Court finds 7 days credit.

14CM1370:
Ct. 2 (DC)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/Counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Absolute Sobriety from Drugs and Alcohol, Court Costs, NO DNA Sample or Surcharge.

Adjourned: 2:40 pm

Status conference on April 4, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Case called:  4:01 pm
Clerk:  Kim H.
14CM552, 14CM1063, 14CM1370, 14TR1181, 14TR3420, 15CF152 and 15CM271
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Defendant appears in person and with Atty Paul Goetz.  Date and time set for Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Reimann is not prepared to go forward, defendant is requesting new counsel and to modify bond.  COURT questions defendant how long it will take him to hire a new attorney.  Defendant to hire new attorney in  about a month.  COURT ORDERS defendant return for Calendar Call every Wed. starting 5/6/15 at 1:00 until he hires an attorney and to report his status, and if he does not appear a warrant may be issued. COURT questions bond modification.  Atty Reimann requests Attic be removed from his bond as it will interfere with his employment.  Defendant makes argument.  COURT explains to defendant to have his new attorney file Notice of Retainer.  State informs Court Day Report was in lieu of cash bond.  Defendant makes argument.  COURT does not address bond at today's hearing -- he can talk to his new attorney regarding his bond.
Bond continues.
Adj.  4:10 pm
Preliminary Hearing on April 28, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

MOTION TO DISMISS IN 14CM552. 
COURT notes amended complaint was filed. COURT questions State regarding amendment to complaint. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT denies motion. 
Reading Waived of amended criminal complaint. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 

REFUSAL HEARING.  
Officer Lisa Rennie sworn and testifies - identifies deft.
Argument. 
COURT makes findings - finds refusal unlawful. 
COURT revokes deft's dl for 3 years and orders 3 years IID to begin immediately and AODA. 
Atty Lister makes statement. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set future dates.
